City distribution center.Sustainable 
Equipment 
ArcBest and ABF Freight continue to 
research and pursue more sustainable 
equipment that contributes to a healthier 
world. Sustainability is not a new focus 
area for us. In 1976, we began voluntarily 
governing maximum truck speeds 
(today at 66 mph) to conserve fuel and 
reduce emissions, and in 1994, we began 
purchasing trucks with computerized engine 
shut offs to reduce idling, minimize fuel 
consumption and limit emissions. 
In 2020, we continued efforts to operate 
clean, fuel-efficient equipment. The average 
age of our ABF road tractors is 22 months, 
and our city power units average six years. 
We also purchased 450 new single-axle 
day-cab tractors and 28 new yard tractors
